title: South Africa: News24 Is Removing Its Comments Section and People Are Freaking Out
text:
South Africa: Giving Faces to South Africa's Missing Children 
On Tuesday, News24, one of South Africa's primary online news destinations, announced that it would be disabling its comments sections, and South Africans had a lot to say about it. AAISHA DADI PATEL rounds up. 
In a statement, News24 editor-in-chief Andrew Trench explained the company's decision saying it had come following "follows months of internal debate and discussion". 
"The end result of these debates is that we have decided that we wish to be known for the quality of our content rather than for our comments," he said. 
It's true that over the years News24 has developed the reputation of being a place where you actually do not want to read the comments, lest you open yourself up to a tsunami of hate and vitriol. Unless you're bored, and looking for something to laugh at, then of course, that's exactly where you go. 
Haha what will people do with their tea breaks now? RT @MyNews24: Farewell to comments: Why we are making a change http://t.co/FnPteRDQI6 
-- Sibongile Mafu (@sboshmafu) September 8, 2015 
#news24comments pic.twitter.com/H4Xe2Sith7 
-- Adrian Ephraim (@AdrianEphraim) September 8, 2015 
When the news came out on Tuesday morning, many were ecstatic. 
Thank you @news24! Your decision to switch off #news24comments on articles has ended digital Apartheid 
-- Ronald Phiri (@RonaldPhiri01) September 8, 2015 
To News24 comments pic.twitter.com/T3WsOo30Qj 
-- OldLadyPants (@oldladypants) September 8, 2015 
HONEST NEWS24 MEDIA STATEMENT: "It was cheaper to disable comments than to hire lawyers for publishing hate speech. Our readers are morons" -- Paul Berkowitz (@paulyberk) September 8, 2015 
Racists when they hear that News24 is shutting down comments. pic.twitter.com/hSK8wy7WUW -- Khaya Dlanga (@khayadlanga) September 8, 2015 
In the good spirit of things, comedian Deep Fried Man even added his two cents to it all 
My very own @News24 comment in reaction to them closing the comments section. pic.twitter.com/xbSY46GTMB 
-- Deep Fried Man (@DeepFriedMan) September 8, 2015 
But some people were highly displeased, and claimed the comments were being closed because of censorship, an ANC conspiracy or "the Dingaan regime". (Ya, we don't know what they're talking about either.) 
BREAKING: @News24 shuts down comments section. Censorship? What happened to freedom of speech! http://t.co/dMc8tkdkp3 pic.twitter.com/XtJGmHws3O -- Leandri J van Vuuren (@Lean3Jvv) September 8, 2015 
The comments under the article saying that #news24comments are closing are *amazing*. pic.twitter.com/dhiVzzcnd6 
-- Sable Banterlope (@comradesipho) September 8, 2015 
Trolls having one last emotional romp on the @News24 article about closing the comments section. LOL @ Keith! pic.twitter.com/recJbIHQoV 
-- Anne Hirsch (@Anne_Hirsch) September 8, 2015 
But seriously though, could this be an attempt by Naspers - Media24's parent company - to further redress its role in supporting apartheid? All is not lost for those who'll miss it the most - as this tweep pointed out, the comments section in the Afrikaans version of the site is still very much active 
Hahaha the Afrikaans News24 has not switched off its comments, i knew there was a loophole pic.twitter.com/RD8jL7EK5M -- Impi isesendeni (@fistvoices) September 8, 2015 South Africa
